intro: Aspidosperma rojasii, commonly known as the Huayna Picchu tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, mountainous environments and is known for its medicinal properties. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their antispasmodic and analgesic effects. Aspidosperma rojasii plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
